LXVIII

CICERO To HIS COLLEAGUE b Ρ. SERVILIUS, PROCONSUL

Ι was exceedingly pleased with your letter which 1 gave me the routes of your various voyagings ; for you implied thereby that you had not forgotten our close association‚ which was the greatest joy of my life. As to the future, it will give me even greater pleasure if you write and tell me in a friendly way all about public affairs,—in other words, about the situation in your province, and the particulars of your administration ; and although, celebrated man as you are, I shall be told all this by many otherS, I should like best of all to get the information out of a letter from you.
